page.title: 01Othery And Its Environs 1985
page.content:
Othery stands on a high ridge on Sedgemoor to the south-east of Middlezoy on the low Somerset wetland levels drained by ditches called 'phines' lined by willow trees. To the east the land rises to the ridge of Ham Hill.
Population 611. Total househlds 198. Owner occupied 73.74%. Rented from Council 16.67%. The main local industry is dairy farming. Other occupations are basket maker, baker, garage mechanics, post office, teachers,builders,innkeeper,undertaker , vicar,cabinet maker, mushroom farmer, guest houses. Cider is made by farmers. The village hall, church, chapel, school and inn are centres of community life.
